properties.title: Launch analysis on Amazon Web service cloud
properties.author: Laurent Jourdren

section.name: Launch analysis on Amazon Web service cloud
section.p: This command launch Eoulsan on Amazon Web Services Cloud. The data is first upload on Amazon S3 storage before running analysis is started using the Amazon Elastic MapReduce (EMR) service. To run Eoulsan on AWS, you must set the AWS credentials in global parameters of your parameter file or in a configuration file. Eoulsan use the AWS Java SDK library to transfer data to Amazon S3 and launch Amazon Elastic MapReduce jobs.

ul.li:
Mandatory parameters:
ParameterValueDescription
parameter patha pathThe path to parameter file to use
design patha pathThe path design file to use
data path on S3a pathThe path where to upload data on S3

Optional parameters:
ParameterValueDescription
-d, --descriptionstringThe description of the analysis. This description will be used as AWS MapReduce job name.

Usage:
$ eoulsan.sh emrexec -d 'My Eoulsan test' param.xml design.txt s3://my-bucket/test

section.p: Experimental: Eoulsan support since version 1.1 the Amazon S3 multipart upload that allow to dramatically increase the speed of the upload. To enable it, set the aws.upload.multipart global parameter to true. The issue related to this new functionality has no effect on Eoulsan results.
